text.p: These are the leading stories in the Turkish press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Turkish businessmen invest heavily in Turkic republics of Central Asia.
- Parliament to debate corruption charges against four former ministers of the conservative Motherland Party.
- Iranian Foreign Minister Ali Akbar Velayati comes to Turkey for Islamic conference.
- Members of Islamist sect detained by police while demonstrating on Sunday will be charged with six separate crimes.

- Relation between Islamist Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan and President Suleyman Demirel getting better after Demirel's tough statements on secularism were interpreted as criticism of Islamists being in power.
- Education and health receive the smallest share from the 1997 budget.
- Government plans to tighten tax collection.
- Court charges journalist Cetin Altan under freedom of expression law.
- Last day to get registered for Hajj pilgrimage to Mecca is November 1.
